record.title: JOINT MEETING OF THE TWO HOUSES--ADDRESS BY THE PRIME MINISTER OF IRELAND
record.narrative:
JOINT MEETING OF THE TWO HOUSES--ADDRESS BY THE PRIME MINISTER OF IRELAND -- (Senate - April 30, 2008)

[Page: S3559]
record.chair: Under the previous order, the Senate will stand in recess until 12 o'clock.

Thereupon, the Senate, at 10:31 a.m., recessed until 12 noon, and the Senate, preceded by the Secretary of the Senate, Nancy Erickson, and the Deputy Sergeant at Arms, Drew Willison, proceeded to the Hall of the House of Representatives to hear the address of the Prime Minister of Ireland, Bertie Ahern.
record.narrative: (The address delivered by the Prime Minister of Ireland to a joint meeting of the two Houses of Congress is printed in the Proceedings of the House of Representatives in today's Record.)
Whereupon, at 12 noon, the Senate, having returned to its Chamber, reassembled and was called to order by the Presiding Officer (Mr. CASEY).
record.chair: The Senator from Virginia is recognized.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent to speak for 10 minutes in morning business.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
